t: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
O*pn Lord,*s how many are my foes! Many*ld are rising against me;
many*ln are saying of my soul, “There*ld is no salvation for him in God.” Selah*ig
But*pn you, O Lord,*s are a shield about me, my*ld glory, and the lifter of my head.
I*ln cried aloud to the Lord,*s and*ld he answered me from his holy hill. Selah*ig
I*pn lay down and slept; I*ld woke again, for the Lord*s sustained me.
I*ln will not be afraid of many thousands of people who*ld have set themselves against me all around.
Arise,*pn O Lord!*s Save*ld me, O my God! For*ln you strike all my enemies on the cheek; you*ld break the teeth of the wicked.
Salvation*pn belongs to the Lord;*s your*ld blessing be on your people! Selah*ig
